intro: Mitranthes clarendonensis, commonly known as the Clarendon glory-of-the-snow, is a flowering plant native to Jamaica. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in the winter months. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist habitats such as forest understories. It has simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a distinct serrated margin. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
